meanings.definition: To rework or reuse old material in a new form.
meanings.sent1: She rehashed her old essay to make it better for the competition.
meanings.sent2: The author rehashed his previous novel to create a new series.
meanings.sent3: The chef rehashed yesterday's soup into a delicious stew.
meanings.sent4: The artist rehashed his old sketches into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The teacher rehashed the lesson with fun activities to help students remember.

meanings.definition: To present (old material) in a new way.
meanings.sent1: He rehashed the same argument in a different tone to persuade his friend.
meanings.sent2: The comedian rehashed his classic jokes with a fresh twist for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The politician rehashed his speech using puppets to make it more engaging.
meanings.sent4: The designer rehashed vintage fashion trends into modern styles.
meanings.sent5: The singer rehashed old songs with a new band arrangement for the concert.
